1. Ninja Foodi Power Blender & Processor System with Smoothie Bowl Maker and Nutrient Extractor – strongest all‑rounder, very versatile (pitcher, personal cups, food‑processor, smoothie bowl).  
2. Blendtec Designer 650 S – premium high‑performance countertop blender, excellent power and presets.  
3. Oster Pro 1200 (with 2 smoothie cups) – 1200 W, good value, strong performance, includes personal cups.  
4. Tefal Perfect Mix+ BL82A – powerful glass‑jar blender with good capacity and features.  
5. Breville the Fresh & Furious – solid mid/high‑range countertop blender focused on smooth blending.  
6. KitchenAid Diamond Blender 5KSB1585 – durable, good general‑purpose blender, fewer advanced features.  
7. Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher 58161 – budget option with travel jar, modest performance.  
8. Smeg Pastel Blue 4‑in‑1 Hand Blender HBF22PBUK – stylish and versatile hand blender, but fundamentally a different (less powerful) category than the countertop blenders above.

1. Ninja Foodi Power Blender & Processor System – most powerful and most versatile (blender, food processor, smoothie bowl, extractor).  
2. Blendtec Designer 650 S – high‑end, very powerful countertop blender with advanced presets.  
3. Breville The Fresh & Furious – strong all‑round countertop blender, good performance and controls.  
4. Tefal Perfect Mix+ BL82A – 1200W, Tritan jar, good programs and durability.  
5. Oster Pro 1200 (BLSTMB‑CBG2‑033) – 1200W, glass jar, comes with 2 smoothie cups.  
6. KitchenAid Diamond Blender 5KSB1585 – solid mid‑range countertop blender, less powerful than above.  
7. Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher 58161 – entry‑level countertop blender, adequate but lower performance.  
8. Smeg Pastel Blue 4‑in‑1 Hand Blender HBF22PBUK – excellent hand blender, but not directly comparable in power/capacity to the countertop models above.

Here’s an absolute ranking from best to worst, based only on the info in the linked pages (power, versatility, jar/system, warranty, and overall capability):

1. **Ninja Foodi Power Blender & Processor System** – 1200W smartTORQUE motor, multiple jars (pitcher, smoothie bowl, nutrient extractor), food‑processor functions, very versatile system.  
2. **Blendtec Designer 650 S** – 1560W, WildSide+ jar, 6 programs, 8 speeds, premium build and long 8‑year warranty; extremely powerful countertop blender.  
3. **Breville the Fresh & Furious** – Around 1100W‑class, high‑end build, good presets and control, strong all‑round countertop unit.  
4. **Oster Pro 1200** – 1200W, 7 speeds, includes 2 smoothie cups; strong performance/value, good versatility but less advanced jar/system than Ninja or Blendtec.  
5. **Tefal Perfect Mix+ BL82A** – 1200W, Tripl’Ax blades, glass jug; solid powerful conventional blender but narrower use‑case than the higher‑ranked systems.  
6. **KitchenAid Diamond Blender 5KSB1585** – 550W‑class, sturdy “Diamond” jar, multiple speeds; reliable but less powerful/versatile than above.  
7. **Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher 58161** – 700W peak, 40oz glass jar + 20oz travel jar, 12 functions; good budget choice but noticeably weaker overall.  
8. **Smeg 4‑in‑1 Hand Blender (Pastel Blue)** – 700W hand blender with accessories; excellent as an immersion/hand tool, but not comparable in power/capacity to the full‑size countertop systems, so ranked last overall.

1. Blendtec Designer 650 S – 1560W, WildSide+ jar, 6 programs, 8 speeds, premium build, 8‑year warranty.

3. Oster Pro 1200 – 1200W, dual‑direction blade, glass jar plus smoothie cups, strong performance/price balance.  
4. Tefal Perfect Mix+ BL82A – 1200W, Tripl’Ax blades, large jar, good all‑round high‑power countertop blender.

6. KitchenAid Diamond Blender 5KSB1585 – ~550–700W range, sturdy, good for everyday smoothies and soups, fewer advanced functions.  
7. Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher 58161 – 700W peak, basic glass jar + travel jar, good budget choice, less powerful.  
8. Smeg 4‑in‑1 Hand Blender – stick blender format; great versatility for small tasks but not comparable to full‑size jug blenders for heavy blending.
